intro: Corydalis tenuis, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, creeping stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers typically range in color from pale pink to white, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Corydalis tenuis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky slopes.
